page.title: 04HOUSING IN SALTCOATS
page.content: About 75% of people live in{Council {Houses,}and 25% in{private houses. The oldest houses still in use are near the town centres - the towns have expanded out into the countryside and few{gap sites}lie empty long. A{typical council house}has 2 or 3 bedrooms, a living room, kitchen and bathroom and costs about{Â£72 rent}per month. Council houses are usually terraced or semi-detached, although there are some blocks of flats also. A{typical private house}might have the same accommodation plus a separate dining-room and will be more likely to be semi-detached. Such a house would cost about Â£27,000 - mortgage payments would be{Â£200}per month. Recently the council have started to {renovate}older buildings of character instead of demolishing them.
